page.title: 09Bournville Village Trust
page.content: When{George Cadbury}moved his business away from the city centre in 1879, he bought land to build both his factory and houses, thus providing a{healthier environment}for his workers and their families. He remained the private owner of the land until 1900 when the {Bournville Village Trust}was formed to manage the estate. From the beginning it has been the policy to build houses for both owner occupiers and tennants. Since the{Leasehold Reform Act of 1967} existing leaseholders have been entitled to purchase their freehold. {The Trust}manages and maintains the estate properties and continues to develop pockets of land for residential purposes whilst maintaining the Cadbury tradition which began with{Â£a Factory in a Garden'}and has evolved into a city suburb with a rural atmosphere.
